abstract: Wells Fargo mostly has resisted the call to put down stakes on Wall Street, but it’s easy to see the allure.
snippet: Wells Fargo mostly has resisted the call to put down stakes on Wall Street, but it’s easy to see the allure.
lead_paragraph: Will Wells Fargo get hooked on Wall Street? The bank, based in California and led by John G. Stumpf, mostly has resisted the siren call to put down stakes in Lower Manhattan. But Wells Fargo kept Wachovia’s fledgling investment bank when it bought its struggling rival three years ago, and the company is still hiring. A couple of senior M.& A. bankers joined just last week. But getting much bigger would come at a price.

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and GEORGE HAY
